Sure! There are many great documentaries out there that are informative, well-researched and factually accurate. Here are a few examples across different genres:

1. "Blackfish" (2013) - This documentary investigates the treatment of killer whales in captivity and the dangers they pose to trainers at amusement parks like Seaworld.

2. "The Act of Killing" (2012) - This documentary investigates the Indonesian genocide of 1965-66 by asking the perpetrators of the violence to reenact their actions in cinematic styles of their choice.

3. "13th" (2016) - This documentary explores America's history of racial inequality, focusing on the 13th Amendment of the U.S. Constitution, which abolished slavery with the exception of punishment for crime.

4. "The Jinx: The Life and Deaths of Robert Durst" (2015) - This HBO series investigates the life of Robert Durst, who is suspected of murdering three people over several decades.

5. "Won't You Be My Neighbor?" (2018) - This documentary examines the life and legacy of Fred Rogers, the host of the PBS children's program "Mister Rogers' Neighborhood."

These documentaries are not only informative but also well-regarded by audiences and critics for their accuracy and thoroughness.
